title: Add sdk docs to the website
body: Signed-off-by: Ryan Beck-Buysse <rbuysse@bitwise.io>

title: Make lists conform to the standard style
body:
By default, list-lines and wrapped-list-lines are indented equally.
The theme in use eliminates all padding, including the indentation
of lists. This applies default padding and settings to lists. BIP-380

Signed-off-by: Sutrannu <bbetts@bitwise.io>

title: Update PBFT and Raft info
body:
Updates the values of the algorithm name and version settings for the
PBFT and Raft consensus engines to match the new values from the
corresponding PRs against the engine repos
(hyperledger/sawtooth-pbft#118,
hyperledger/sawtooth-raft#59)

Also updates FAQs to match status of PBFT.

title: Update ruby-image version for compatibility

Docs will be included, but not linked yet.

title: Add Instructions for Network Binding
body:
Bind to 0.0.0.0 or network IP address, instead of 127.0.0.1.

Also fix syntax error (title underline too short).

Signed-off-by: danintel <daniel.anderson@intel.com>

title: Update FAQ
body:
* Add B9Lab online Sawtooth developer course
* Add recommended PoET settings for small test networks
* Mention /etc/sawtooth/path.toml.example for directory configuration
* Add Consensus Engine SDK slides for the 20180426 Tech Forum video
* Add answers for consensus engine starting order
* Add back pressure test answer
* Add ``failed state root hash validation`` answer
* Add corrections for App Dev Guide Ubuntu install instructions
* Add PoET fork answer
* Add key file not readable answer
* Add file permission answer
* Add installation answer for nightly on Bionic
* Validator default is now parallel mode
* Add PoET create wait certificate error answer
* Add PoET BFT answer
* Add Grafana video
* Add PoET CFT production use qualification
* Add Rust SDK development for MS Windows
* Add Sawtooth 1.2 Ubuntu Devmode installation instructions
* Add consensus engine settings
* Add nightly package install workaround for Bionic
* Add Certified Hyperledger Sawtooth Administrator (CHSA) information
* Add Sawtooth Explorer instructions
* Update PBFT settings

Signed-off-by: danintel <daniel.anderson@intel.com>

title: Add Sawtooth PBFT to mininav; put in alph order
body:
A previous PR added Sawtooth PBFT to the end of the page, but it wasn't in the top navigation.

This PR fixes that omission. It also moves the Sawtooth PBFT section up so that the page continues to list Sawtooth products in alphabetical order.

Signed-off-by: Anne Chenette <chenette@bitwise.io>

title: Fix archive fetch timestamp checking
body:
Improved wget, curl and tar usage to check timestamps and eliminate
re-fetching. Moved fetching and collation to the generator container.
Added standalone Dockerfile to build minimal webserver container.

Signed-off-by: Sutrannu <bbetts@bitwise.io>

This change allows Jenkins to build and archive the website, for
publishing

title: Add Build-Only option
body:
Add environment option to stop after generating the site. For automated deployment.

E.g.: `BUILDONLY=true docker-compose up`

title: Add Dan Anderson as a sawtooth-website maintainer
body: I am proposing Dan Anderson as a maintainer on this repository because of Dan's work helping the community (via RocketChat, for example) as well as maintaining a Sawtooth FAQ (https://github.com/danintel/sawtooth-faq/). The FAQ will be integrated into this repository soon, which is a significant contribution.

Added community pages in rst for verification.

Add jekyll generation of static index and other pages
Add linting on startup.
